contract out.translation[0].definitions[: to arrange to have a job done by a person or company outside your own organization
We contracted the catering out to an outside firm.
to agree officially not to take part in something such as a pension plan
contract out.translation[1].definitions[: to agree officially not to take part in an arrangement
If your company uses the state pension scheme and you want to contract out, then you can also have a personal pension.
to arrange to have a job done by a person outside your organization
